item.title: Amazon Great Republic Day Sale starts on 13th January; Up to 65% off on washing machines, refrigerators and more - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Amazon Great Republic Day Sale starts on 13th January; Up to 65% off on washing machines, refrigerators and more

Date: January 10, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Amazon Great Republic Day Sale kicks off on 13th January, featuring discounts of up to 65% on a variety of home appliances. This event offers an excellent opportunity for consumers looking to upgrade their household items at affordable prices.

  • Discounts available on washing machines, refrigerators, air conditioners, chimneys, and dishwashers.
  • Massive savings on top-rated brands for home appliances.
  • Exclusive bank discounts available for additional savings.
"Don’t miss out on the Amazon Sale 2025 deals and grab your favourites before they sell out."

With an array of products and deep discounts, the Amazon Great Republic Day Sale promises exciting shopping experiences for every household. Be sure to mark your calendars!

item.title: Top startup and tech stories this week - The Economic Times
item.description:
Top Startup and Tech Stories This Week

Date: This week

Source: ETtech

Welcome to a new edition of ETtech Unwrapped – our weekend newsletter packed with the most important stories this week. Here are the top highlights:

  • Exclusive Q&A with Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella: He emphasizes the need for the US to innovate and compete, stating, "Anyone who doesn't tap into India's human capital is choosing not to be competitive."
  • Kabeer Biswas joins Flipkart: The cofounder of Dunzo will lead Flipkart’s quick commerce business, Minutes.
  • Improved Financials for Startups: Several startups have ended FY24 with improved bottom lines despite funding challenges.
  • NRAI to approach CCI: The National Restaurant Association of India may challenge Zomato and Swiggy over their new 10-minute food delivery offerings.
  • Sachin Bansal’s potential sale of Ola stake: Flipkart’s cofounder is reportedly in talks to sell his $100 million investment in Ola at a premium.
  • Innovaccer raises $275 million: The SaaS firm closes a new funding round for AI and cloud development.
  • Swiggy launches multiple delivery apps: New apps introduced include Pyng for professional services and Snacc for quick food delivery.
  • Data protection regulations: The new DPDP rules may open opportunities for regulatory-tech firms in compliance and privacy sectors.
Saty Nadella asserted that tech and non-tech distinctions will disappear as we embrace AI.

Overall, the tech landscape is evolving with significant investments, strategic leadership changes, and regulatory developments that may shape the future of startups in India.

item.title: 7 announcements to expect at the Samsung Galaxy S25 Unpacked event (and 3 not to) - Android Police
item.description:
7 announcements to expect at the Samsung Galaxy S25 Unpacked event (and 3 not to)

Publication Date: January 22, 2025
Source: Android Police

Samsung's next Galaxy Unpacked event is scheduled for January 22, 2025, in San Jose, California, focusing on AI advancements and the new Galaxy S25 series.

  • The Galaxy S25 series will include the S25, S25 Plus, and S25 Ultra.
  • A new model, the Galaxy S25 Slim, is rumored to be revealed.
  • One UI 7 will feature prominently with a major visual overhaul.
  • A next-gen Bixby AI assistant is expected to launch.
  • Samsung XR smart glasses are anticipated, possibly launching in late 2025.
  • The Galaxy Ring 2 may debut alongside enhancements.
  • Refurbished Galaxy S24 models will likely be placed on sale soon after the S25 launch.
  • The event will not showcase tri-fold or rollable phones.
  • Samsung may consider dropping the Galaxy branding for its premium devices.
"AI will be the focus of the event." - Samsung announcement

This event promises to be filled with innovative announcements as Samsung continues to push the boundaries of technology.

item.title: CES 2025: Gigabyte announces AI-powered hardware lineup, featuring new graphics cards, laptops, and more - The Times of India
item.description:
CES 2025: Gigabyte announces AI-powered hardware lineup, featuring new graphics cards, laptops, and more

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

At CES 2025, Gigabyte showcased their latest lineup of AI-powered hardware, including cutting-edge graphics cards and laptops designed to enhance gaming and productivity.

  • Introduction of new AI-enhanced graphics cards that promise improved performance.
  • Launch of innovative laptops incorporating state-of-the-art cooling solutions.
  • Focus on sustainability with improved energy efficiency in hardware.
  • Demonstrations of real-time rendering and machine learning applications.
"Our new lineup emphasizes AI integration to maximize user experience and system efficiency," said a Gigabyte representative.

This new hardware lineup from Gigabyte signifies their commitment to keeping pace with technological advancements and responding to consumer needs in the gaming and professional sectors.

item.title: 17 weird, wonderful and terrifying robots we've seen at CES 2025 so far — from a humanlike 'companion' to a robotic mixologist - Livescience.com
item.description:
17 Unique and Innovative Robots at CES 2025

Date: January 15, 2025 Source: Live Science

CES 2025 showcases a wide array of robots from therapeutic machines to robotic pets. This year's highlights show significant advancements in AI and robotics.

  • A Pixar-like robot lamp called Mi-Mo, customizable and adaptable.
  • The R2D3 droid, designed to assist with household tasks using advanced AI.
  • The Wybot S2 Pro, a pool-cleaning robot that autonomously returns to charge.
  • The HAGAMOSphere, a drone that can both roll and fly, ideally for disaster recovery.
  • Aria, a humanlike android designed to learn and interact.
  • The SwitchBot K20+ Pro, featuring robotic arms for cleaning and other tasks.
  • BeatBot's robotic turtle aimed at ocean cleanup and research.
  • Samsung's Ballie, a home assistant droid inspired by Star Wars.
  • Unitree's backflipping robot dog.
  • A mini robotic dog designed to teach coding.
  • Mirokaï, an android with an animated digital face.
  • LOOI, a robot created using a smartphone app.
  • Mirumi, a furry robot companion that attaches to bags.
  • A robotic coffee machine that creates intricate coffee art.
  • ADAM, a robotic bartender with AI capabilities.
  • An autonomous wheel that can transform any object into a robot.
  • A chess-playing robot with a high ELO skill level.
"The future is about integrating AI with human-like interaction in household robots." - Live Science

This year's CES highlights how robotics are becoming an integral part of everyday life, showcasing advancements that blend technology with creativity.

item.title: POCO launches X7 series with Brand Ambassador Akshay Kumar - Greater Kashmir
item.description:
POCO Launches X7 Series with Akshay Kumar as Brand Ambassador

Date: January 10, 2023 | Source: Greater Kashmir

Srinagar, Jan 10: POCO, one of India’s fastest-growing consumer tech brands, unveiled its flagship X7 Series—POCO X7 5G and POCO X7 Pro 5G—at an event in Jaipur. Bollywood actor Akshay Kumar was introduced as the brand ambassador, embodying POCO’s philosophy of “Xceed Your Limits.”

  • The POCO X7 series introduces the segment’s first 1.5K AMOLED 3D Curved Display.
  • It features flagship-grade Corning Gorilla Glass protection and an IP66+ rating for water and dust resistance.
  • The POCO X7 Pro has India's largest 6550mAh battery with Silicon Carbon Technology for improved efficiency.
  • The series debuts the MediaTek Dimensity 8400 Ultra processor and features Xiaomi HyperOS 2.0.
Himanshu Tandon, Country Head of POCO India, said, “At POCO, innovation drives every decision we make. With the X7 Series, we are setting new benchmarks in the premium smartphone category.”

This launch exemplifies POCO's commitment to bringing flagship innovation at an incredible value to its users while enhancing its brand appeal through a prominent ambassador.

item.title: OnePlus 12 vs. OnePlus 13: Is it upgraded enough? [Video] - 9to5Google
item.description:
OnePlus 12 vs. OnePlus 13: Is the Upgrade Worth It?

Publication Date: January 7, 2025
Source: 9to5Google

The OnePlus 12 surprised many in 2024, setting high expectations for its successor, the OnePlus 13. This article analyzes whether the latest model brings enough new features to justify upgrading.

  • OnePlus 13 retains a similar design to OnePlus 12 with improvements in shape and a flat display.
  • The 13 features a better ultrasonic in-display fingerprint scanner.
  • Enhancements in battery technology with a 6,000 mAh capacity, compared to 5,400 mAh in the 12.
  • Camera system improvements but some downgrades in optical zoom capabilities.
  • OxygenOS 15 offers a fresh experience across both models.
“Nobody who owns the OnePlus 12 should ditch their device in favor of the OnePlus 13.”

In conclusion, while the OnePlus 13 introduces several enhancements, existing OnePlus 12 users may find the upgrades insufficient to warrant a switch.

item.title: AMD Radeon RX 9070 expected to start at $479, available as soon as late January - TechSpot
item.description:
AMD Radeon RX 9070 Expected to Start at $479, Available Soon

Publication Date: January 10, 2025 | Source: TechSpot

A new mid-range GPU from AMD, the Radeon RX 9070, is rumored to be priced at $479 upon release, with custom models possibly starting at $549. Speculation suggests an announcement could happen in late January.

  • AMD is expected to reveal the RX 9070 and RX 9070 XT GPUs soon, with a focus on competitive pricing.
  • The expected price for the RX 9070 XT is $479, aligning with AMD’s goal of catering to a budget-conscious market.
  • Official pricing and specifications may be unveiled by January 22, alongside reviews.
  • AMD's timing appears to be strategic, waiting for Nvidia’s pricing announcements to position their products accordingly.
"Pricing rumors should always be taken with a grain of salt until official confirmation arrives."

This release could significantly impact the mid-range GPU market, especially in relation to Nvidia’s offerings.

item.title: Tech wrap Jan 10: Xiaomi Pad 7 launch, OnePlus 13 sale, DailyObjects LOOP - Business Standard
item.description:
Tech wrap Jan 10: Xiaomi Pad 7 launch, OnePlus 13 sale, DailyObjects LOOP

Publication Date: January 10, 2023

Source: Unknown

This article covers the latest tech news including the launch of the Xiaomi Pad 7 and OnePlus 13 in India and new products from DailyObjects.

  • Xiaomi Pad 7: Features Qualcomm Snapdragon 7 Plus Gen 3, available with a Nano Texture Display and runs on HyperOS 2.
  • OnePlus 13: Launched on January 7, powered by Snapdragon 8 Elite, equipped with Hasselblad camera, running Oxygen OS 15.
  • DailyObjects LOOP: New series of MagSafe-compatible power banks, Qi2-certified, with 15W wireless charging.
  • Redmi 14C 5G: Up for sale in India starting at Rs 9,999, featuring dual 5G support and premium design.
  • Google AI Podcast: Testing personalized daily podcasts feature called Daily Listen.
  • Meta's Content Moderation Changes: Increased searches on deleting accounts following changes in moderation policy.
  • Meta Discontinuation: Ending third-party fact-checking in the US, shifting to user-generated Community Notes.

item.title: OnePlus 13 series is now available for purchase: Price in India, offers and more - The Times of India
item.description:
OnePlus 13 series is now available for purchase: Price in India, offers and more

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Tech News

The OnePlus 13 series has officially launched in India, offering new models with enhanced features and attractive pricing. Customers can benefit from various promotional offers upon purchase.

  • Multiple models available, including the OnePlus 13 Pro.
  • Competitive pricing aimed at capturing the mid-range smartphone market.
  • Special offers available through select retailers and online platforms.
“This series represents our commitment to innovation and value for money,” said a company spokesperson.

The launch of the OnePlus 13 series marks an important milestone for the brand, as it competes in a crowded smartphone market.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S25 series full specs leaked ahead of January 22 Unpacked event: Details - The Financial Express
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy S25 Series Full Specs Leaked Ahead of January 22 Unpacked Event

Publication Date: January 15, 2024

Source: Financial Express

The Galaxy S25 series is set for launch soon, and leaks reveal detailed specifications for the Galaxy S25, Galaxy S25+, and Galaxy S25 Ultra models, including their display, performance, and camera features.

Key Points

  • The Galaxy S25 features a 6.2-inch Dynamic AMOLED 2X display with Full HD+ (2340 x 1080) resolution and a 120Hz refresh rate.
  • It is powered by the Snapdragon 8 Elite for Galaxy chipset with 12GB of RAM and storage options of 128GB, 256GB, and 512GB.
  • Camera setup includes a 50MP primary, 12MP ultrawide, and 10MP telephoto lens with OIS.
  • Battery capacity stands at 4,000mAh with 25W wired fast charging and wireless charging support.
  • The Galaxy S25+ has a larger screen at 6.7 inches, WQHD resolution, a bigger 4,900mAh battery, and similar camera specifications.
  • The flagship Galaxy S25 Ultra includes a 6.9-inch display, advanced 200MP camera, and a capacity of up to 1TB storage.

Notable Quotes or Statistics

The S25 Ultra model features the highest level of detail and color accuracy with its massive 6.9-inch display and exceptional camera capabilities.

The phone runs on Android 15 with Samsung’s One UI 7 for a user-friendly experience.

item.title: OnePlus 13R Review: A well-rounded, affordable flagship that’s high on performance - The Indian Express
item.description:
OnePlus 13R Review: A well-rounded, affordable flagship that’s high on performance

Publication Date: January 10, 2025

Source: The Indian Express

The OnePlus 13R is a new budget-friendly flagship smartphone from OnePlus, aimed at delivering high performance without breaking the bank. This review shares insights into its design, display, camera capabilities, and overall performance based on hands-on experience.

Key Points:

  • Top-notch specifications at a lower price compared to OnePlus 13.
  • Features a 6.78-inch ProXDR flat display with 120Hz refresh rate.
  • Powered by Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 and a 6000mAh battery for extensive usage.
  • Camera includes a 50 MP primary sensor, alongside ultra-wide and portrait lenses.
  • Offers a lightweight design and a premium finish.

Notable Quotes:

“The OnePlus 13R strikes a balance between performance, design, and affordability.”
“It’s lightweight, has a premium finish, and is an overall compelling choice for everyday usability.”

In conclusion, the OnePlus 13R is a well-rounded smartphone offering a blend of performance and affordability, ideal for users seeking flagship features without the premium price tag.

item.title: S Pen in Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra to lose Bluetooth functionality - GSMArena.com news - GSMArena.com
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra S Pen Loses Bluetooth Functionality

Publication Date: Two weeks from now
Source: Leakster Ishan Agarwal

Samsung is set to unveil the Galaxy S25 series in two weeks. The Galaxy S25 Ultra, featuring rounded corners and a built-in S Pen, seems to be losing its Bluetooth functionality.

  • The S Pen will forfeit Bluetooth capabilities, eliminating features like gestures and remote control.
  • Current Bluetooth functions include taking photos, switching cameras, and changing photo modes via gestures.
  • The feature set, known as Air Actions, will no longer be available in the S Pen for the Galaxy S25 Ultra.
  • This change may discourage some users from upgrading to the new series.
"Eliminating remote control features seems like a step back."

This decision by Samsung may point to design changes that accommodate a subtly smaller stylus fitting into the device.

item.description:
Elon Musk’s gaming stats questioned by top players: “He literally has no idea…”

Publication Date: Not available   |   Source: Not available

Elon Musk, known for his ventures in technology and space, faces scrutiny from top gamers regarding his gaming stats, raising concerns about his understanding of the gaming community.

  • Top players criticize Musk's lack of gaming knowledge.
  • Musk's reputation in tech doesn't translate to gaming success.
  • The debate unfolds within the broader context of gaming culture.
“He literally has no idea…” - Comment from a top player regarding Musk's statistics.

This critique highlights a growing divide between gaming professionals and celebrities entering the space, emphasizing the importance of genuine engagement in the gaming community.

item.title: Elon Musk’s GrokAI chatbot gets a dedicated app: How to access and more - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Elon Musk’s GrokAI chatbot gets a dedicated app: How to access and more

Date: January 10, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Grok, the AI assistant integrated into the X social media platform, is now available as a standalone application for iPhones, offering real-time information, image generation, and more, making it accessible to a variety of users.

  • GrokAI is now a standalone app available for iPhone users.
  • The app offers capabilities such as real-time information retrieval and image generation.
  • This launch expands the accessibility of GrokAI beyond the X platform.
“Grok, the AI assistant integrated into the X social media platform, is now available as a standalone application”

The launch of GrokAI as a dedicated app marks a notable expansion in how users can access AI technology.

item.title: Buying NVIDIA RTX 50 Series GPU? Here's the pricing for the RTX 5070, 5070 Ti, 5080, and 5090 in India | Mint - Mint
item.description:
NVIDIA RTX 50 Series GPU Pricing Revealed in India

Publication Date: January 2025
Source: Live Mint

At CES 2025, Nvidia unveiled its latest 50 series GPUs, known as the Blackwell GPUs, featuring four new models with significantly improved performance over the previous generation.

NVIDIA RTX 50 Series Price And Availability In India

  • RTX 5070: ₹59,000
  • RTX 5070 Ti: ₹80,000
  • RTX 5080: ₹1,07,000
  • RTX 5090: ₹2,14,000

Availability for RTX 5090 and RTX 5080 starts on January 30, while RTX 5070 Ti and RTX 5070 will be released in February.

All GPUs feature DLSS 4 compatibility and GDDR7 memory.

  • RTX 5070: 12 GB GDDR7, 6,144 CUDA cores, TDP 250 watts.
  • RTX 5070 Ti: 16 GB GDDR7, 8,960 CUDA cores, TDP 300 watts.
  • RTX 5080: 16 GB GDDR7, 10,752 CUDA cores, TDP 360 watts.
  • RTX 5090: 32 GB GDDR7, 21,760 CUDA cores, TDP 575 watts.

item.title: Assassin's Creed Shadows First DLC Seemingly Leaks, Adds a New Map and Over 10 Hours of Content - IGN
item.description:
Assassin's Creed Shadows First DLC Seemingly Leaks, Adds a New Map and Over 10 Hours of Content

Publication Date: N/A

Source: IGN

Ubisoft has seemingly leaked the first expansion for Assassin's Creed Shadows, called Claws of Awaji, which will add a new map and over 10 hours of content.

  • The game's Steam page revealed details about the expansion, indicating it will add a new region with additional gameplay.
  • Major updates include the removal of the Season Pass model, suggesting greater accessibility for players.
  • Claws of Awaji may explore Japanese mythology, particularly regarding Awaji Island.
  • The game has faced delays, now pushed to March 20, which has intensified fan anticipation.
  • Ubisoft's promotional period has been marred by controversies and apologies related to cultural representation.
"Travel to a new region, get over 10 hours of additional content, and unlock new weapon types, new skills, gear, and abilities."

This new content is expected to rejuvenate player interest, although it comes in a challenging period for Ubisoft.

item.title: Samsung Unpacked 2025: Galaxy S25, S25+, S25 Ultra price and key details leaked ahead of the launch event - HT Tech
item.description:
Samsung Unpacked 2025: Key Details and Price Leak for Galaxy S25 Series

Publication Date: January 22, 2025

Source: Tech Hindustan Times

Samsung has announced that its Galaxy Unpacked event will unveil the flagship Galaxy S25 series, with leaked pricing and features surfacing ahead of the launch.

Pricing Details

  • The Galaxy S25 starts at 964 euros (~Rs. 85,000) for the base model.
  • The Galaxy S25+ is expected to start at 1,235 euros (~Rs. 1,09,000).
  • The Galaxy S25 Ultra pricing starts at 1,557 euros (~Rs. 1,38,000).

Storage and Color Options

  • Galaxy S25 available in 128GB, 256GB, and 512GB.
  • Galaxy S25 Ultra could feature up to 1TB of storage.
  • Color options include icy blue, mint, navy, and silver for S25 and S25+, and titanium variants for S25 Ultra.

Pre-Reservations

Pre-reservations for the Galaxy S25 series are available in India with benefits worth Rs. 5,000.

“The new OneUI7 interface will likely be introduced alongside the Galaxy S25 series.”

As anticipation builds for the Galaxy Unpacked event, the S25 series promises appealing choices for consumers.
